Articles.Content:
Version 1.0 has now been released - please check out the [official release thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/127575) for more details!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-03T01:28:22Z" title="07/03/2015 01:28  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 3, 2015</time> by seanmcdougall**
  
Released version 1.0.0
This is an great idea!!!

this actually solves a lot of problems with part menus. One feature request tho would be an ability to display more than one window at a time. For monitoring purposes, mainly - but also for quicker action on parts you know you'll need to mess with

Just found out about this mod. Love the idea. Though for future versions. If possible hide/disable all the buttons in the Rclick menu when using the mod as a lot of mods put info in that menu that just needs to be seen not interacted with. It can at times be split between the top and bottom of a long menu with a ton of buttons between. If you hide/disable all the buttons we use this mod to active stuff and the Rclick is clean for just info to be presented. Just a thought. Thanks!

Forget everything I said this mod is even awesomer! You perfectly display all the info from the menu it is not just the buttons. Very nice work! Only things missing I saw was when enabling the F12 menu thermal readouts. Rad flux, Conv flux, Cond flux, Int flux, Thermal mass, and Temp ext are not displayed. This was with FAR and DR. Latest dev build of FAR and latest release of DR.
You're amazing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Awesome. I've been using Action Group Manager for this and have always wished I could just access the context actions directly.

ya, if you could fix the vessel switch bug, then this would be perfect. It messes up after boarding (eva), but a quick save/load gets it back in order.

Maybe put in an action group editor after you get all the current stuff done.
Looks interesting, how did you manage this?

@Tontow - I probably won't get into any action group stuff since there are already a few mods that handle those (ie Action Group Manager, Action Groups Extended)

@FreeThinker - basically I loop through all the parts on the active vessel, then through the active part modules, then through each field and event. After that it was a matter of figuring out which ones should be displayed and which should be hidden - multi-mode engines like the R.A.P.I.E.R were especially troublesome. I spent lots of time in the debugger ([thanks sarbian](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114241)!) trying to sort out how everything works. The hardest part though was actually figuring out all the Unity GUI stuff... this was my first time messing with that. Check out the code on Github if you want the gory details...
Could you make it accessible through RPM ? (unless such a mod had already been made)
@BenjiGH - good idea, but it looks like a fair bit of work - I"ll have to save that for a future release after I get the basics working the way I want.
Version 0.9.1 is now available! The big new feature is persistent window settings (which turned out to be a bigger pain than I was expecting, but it all seems to be working now).
Just uploaded version 0.9.1.1 with a quick fix for an issue where the window could get corrupted if the selected part was destroyed.

Would consider nesting parts under their parent parts like vessel viewer does and/or add a toggle for alphabetical sorting? Love this mod so much it was a dream come true when you made this ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Thanks! Actually I was just working on an alphabetical sort today, so that will be in the next release. I like the nesting idea though... might help with making long part lists more manageable. I'll see what I can do :-)
wow great mod! +1 for CKAN release ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks! I'll definitely be releasing through CKAN when it's ready. Almost there, just a few more tweaks. Real life keeps getting in the way ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Version 0.9.2 is now available!

    0.9.2 - 2015/06/23- updated to support KSP 1.0.3/1.0.4- added filtering/sorting options- added ability to "pop off" parts into their own windows

As long as no major issues crop up, I'm planning the official release for this weekend.
Just noticed a bug affecting the display of jet engines so I've uploaded 0.9.2.1 as a quick fix.
Version 0.9.3 is now up... another round of bug fixes, code cleanup, and some new features.
